Biography

CAREER COLLEGIATE RESULTS

Competed for the Wildcats from 2018-24 ... Standout middle distance runner on a national level during his collegiate career ... Capped off his time with the Wildcats by qualifying for the 2024 outdoor NCAA Championships and earning honorable mention All-America status in the 1500 meters ... In 2024 was part of the Villanova 4xMile relay squad along with Sean Donoghue, Marco Langon and Liam Murphy which recorded the second-fastest time in world history (15:51.91) ... The mark set a new collegiate, Penn Relays, BIG EAST and Villanova record ... Ran the second leg of the relay in 4:00.09 in the first-ever sub-16 minute 4xMile performance in Penn Relays history ... Ranks third in school history in the 3000 meters (7:46.67) and sixth in the mile (3:54.16) ... Anchored a school record performance in the distance medley relay (9:20.44) with a 1600 meter split of 3:53.97 in February 2023 ... Went on to earn second team All-America honors as part of the relay later that season ... Individual BIG EAST champion in the mile in 2023 ... Was a part of three BIG EAST titles in relays and is a 12-time career All-BIG EAST performer counting cross country as well as the indoor and outdoor seasons ... Competed at the NCAA Championships in cross country four times and outdoor track & field once ... One of 48 members of Villanova's sub-four minute mile club ... He is one of five runners from his hometown club -- Leevale Athletic Club in Cork, Ireland -- to be a sub-four minute miler ... Three of the five are Villanovans, including O'Donovan along with his high school coach Ken Nason and his college coach Marcus O'Sullivan ... Two-time Penn Relays champion in the 4xMile relay ... Four-time outdoor qualifier for the NCAA East Preliminary meet in the 1500 meters ... Prior to coming to Villanova was the Irish national U20 champion in the 1500 meters in 2017 ... Has represented Ireland at numerous international competitions, including the European Championships at the U18 and U20 levels ... Named to the USTFCCCA All-Academic Team in both cross country and track & field in 2022-23 … Four-time selection to the BIG EAST All-Academic Team and eight-time member of the Athletic Director’s Honor Roll … Villanova graduate who is pursuing his postgraduate degree while completing his collegiate eligibility on the track.

NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL COMPETITION

One of five runners from his home club – Leevale Athletic Club in Cork City – who has became a sub-four minute miler … Three of the five are Villanovans, including both his high school coach Ken Nason and collegiate coach Marcus O’Sullivan … Has represented Ireland at five international competitions during his career, including four European Championships at the U18 and U20 levels … Was the national U20 champion in the 1500 meters in 2017 … Competed at the Irish Life Health National Senior Championships in June 2021 and tallied a fifth place finish in the final … Posted a time of 3:50.71 in the final after winning his preliminary heat in 3:55.63.

BEFORE VILLANOVA

Colaiste Chriost Ri: Competed in track & field and cross country and was coached by former Villanova standout Ken Nason … Two-time National Schools champion in the 1500 meters in 2017 and 2018 … Six-time Provincial Schools champion.

Personal: Born 8/6/99 in Cork, Ireland … Son of Michelle and Reynolds O'Donovan … Has an older brother, James Fitzgerald (37) … Hobbies include guitar and playing soccer, and is interested in a variety of sports … Chose to attend Villanova for its rich track & field tradition, the elite level of the coaching staff and the school’s high academic standards … Enrolled in the Villanova School of Business ... Marketing major.
